page.title: 02Kingsley village
page.content: There are many facilities in Kingsley. The elderly are well catered for as essentials can be bought from the butchers grocers, haberdashers/ hardware and Post Office shops. Mobile vans with fresh fish, fish and chips and Library books call. Although doctors, dentists and banking facilities are lacking there is a voluntary drug collection service. For other facilities there is an hourly bus service from Cheadle to Hanley. The local coach company also runs excursions. Young families appreciate the pre-school play-group and Primary School. The Church is well attended and has a thriving Sunday School. Various clubs are well supported, the WI, keep-fit, Yoga, Youth Club, Football, Bowling and Gardeners Association, also regular Whist Drives and Bingo sessions.
